Lead Summary: Do you love your website? Does it make a good or bad first impression of you? Lead to the opportunities you seek? (Stop with the evil questions! üòà üòá)  I ask these because first impressions matter in business, and often, your website is the first interaction customers will have with you. Will it be GOOD or BAD? üòà  I build websites, and my two aims are: 1) be better than competitors and 2) be discoverable in search.  #1 You must rid of the bad first impression.  We've all experienced the horrors of making a bad first impression (potential date, job interview, public speaking, .etc). It's a dreadful feeling, but even worse, it typically means not getting the opportunity we want.   Your website plays a major role in making a good or bad first impression of you. When potential customers and even referrals land on your website and get confused by the text or find the design not modern or just hard to navigate, they lose confidence in reaching out to you.    The naughty of bad websites: ‚ùå Potential customers lose trust in your abilities versus your competition. ‚ùå Unclear design, confusing (non-punchy) text, and slow-loading websites sway people away.  #2 Leverage your website to be your 24/7 marketing tool that stands above competitors.  On the contrary, a good website can be the secret sauce to good first impressions. Think about it...how many times have you looked at a competitor's website, felt envious, and wished that your website could look like theirs?  We all have, but I believe that if your website shows that you can solve customer problems, that you are genuinely "enjoyable" to work with, and is enjoyable to browse because your design and copy are relevant and slick, potential customers will be more willing to reach out.   The secret sauce of good websites: ‚úÖ Customers love to work with those who seem relatable, knowledgeable, and inspiring. ‚úÖ Great design, word clarity, and being discoverable via search engines make you appear as the traits mentioned above and ultimately stand above your competition.  This is the website superpower and a marketing tool that can work for you 24/7.  If you're looking to build a new website, I'd love to learn more. Let's design your good first impression because it's absolute power!  I'm Mike, and I've been designing websites for over a decade, making 200+ websites for businesses and educators. I have also taught web design and marketing to thousands of students worldwide.   More about me here: https://www.webodew.com/about  Stand out. Be found. Win clients!

Company Li Description: Climate is a complex system, it‚Äôs especially important to band together and drive solutions. And the space is changing so quickly that the best way to stay ahead is to surround yourself with leaders at the forefront of their climate niches.  Climate Vine is a membership network to help us do exactly that. Members come from diverse backgrounds, ranging from policy activism, investment, corporations, non-profits, entrepreneurship, and tech & science. Each cohort of 100-150 experts are gathered through a competitive application process.   In the yearlong membership, Members can expect to spend about 1-3 hours a week on Climate Vine in curated small groups, socials and off-the-record conversations with other experts in their space.   Connect with diverse, interdisciplinary  experts: We assemble each 150 person cohort via a competitive application process to create a diverse collective.  Enjoy off the record conversations and meetups: Share knowledge with your peers, build a supportive community across silos, and exchange ideas with the best in climate.  Explore your next steps with intention: Our Members find new roles, fresh ideas and mission-aligned collaborators thanks to the connections they make.  Interested in strategically unlocking ideas, talent, and partnerships to accelerate your climate impact?  Apply (takes ~5 minutes) for an upcoming cohort here: https://gmfcq198bgj.typeform.com/application-1?utm_source=linkedin
Lead Summary: I am an innovative, strategic, and analytical climate expert skilled in connecting people, ideas, and data to create a future where everyone can thrive. For nearly 20 years, I've researched, shaped, and implemented cutting edge strategies, policies, and initiatives to advance equitable climate mitigation and adaptation, economic inclusion, clean air, resilient clean energy and infrastructure, public health, and smarter land use and transportation systems. Just recently, I've completed several core business courses to further develop a private sector lens for this work.   My experience at all levels of government (U.S. Congress, federal, state, and local), two non-profits, and a foundation, provides me with unique insight into their complementary roles and how to successfully navigate each world to effect change and build effective partnerships. In addition, recent pro bono work focuses on the intersection of climate with equity and business.    Specific skills include: policy and data analysis; policy design; strategy and planning; problem solving; program development; network and partnership building; quantitative and qualitative research; written and oral communication; creating executable plans; leading and working in teams; building internal support for action; facilitation.    Notable projects include:  - Risky Business Project (https://riskybusiness.org),  - WiCT+ and Aon report on Gender Equity and Net Zero (https://climate-gender.aon.com/, Strategy Team Lead for TECFD effort),   - 2022 Alameda County Climate Action Plan (https://www.acgov.org/sustain/what/climate/22plan.htm) (digital community engagement strategy was 2023 Granicus Digital Government Awards Finalist),  - AB 2800, 2013 STRONG Act - CA state guidance on resilient infrastructure (https://opr.ca.gov/planning/icarp/resilient-ca.html, TAG member)  I have authored or co-authored 8 reports and 4 articles on climate change, air pollution, and health published in peer-reviewed journals, including the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences. I am a contributor to an upcoming second edition of a textbook on Climate Change and Public Health. I have also been quoted in National Geographic and LA Times for my work.

Company Li Description: At Normal, our mission is to¬†make AI universally scalable and useful.   AI has been subject to technological limitations such as unpredictable factual errors in generative AI or lack of auditability as black-box models. We believe that AI can unlock transformative value in enterprise applications by reasoning reliably, autonomously, and understanding its own limits.   Our products enable AI deployment in high-stakes enterprise applications. Unlike other surface-level approaches, our approach involves redesigning AI systems from the ground up. Normal's AI application development platform is powered by novel full-stack probabilistic machine learning infrastructure driven by thermodynamic physics.   Normal was founded by former engineers from Google Brain, Alphabet X, and Palantir. We engage with leading institutions across various industries, including services, manufacturing, and the public sector.
Lead Summary: Tackling key practical AI scaling and reliability challenges through unifying approaches to physics and computation. I love collaborating with other builders on mission-driven tech.  I've scaled products and conducted research largely enabled by Bayesian and quantum machine learning.

Company Li Description: A stealth startup is a startup company that operates in stealth mode, i.e. that avoids public attention. This may be done to hide information from competitors, or ‚Äî as part of a marketing strategy ‚Äî to manage public image. The phenomenon is well known in the venture capital (VC) community. Normally a company would only operate in stealth mode for the first couple of years. As investors may have to disclose funding a stealth startup, their names are made public, but often only a general summary description is known about the company. "Most entrepreneurs say they are in stealth because they are worried about competitors stealing their ideas. This can be a risk if you have such a simple idea that just by hearing it, someone can replicate it."‚Äã

Company Li Description: Arrakis has a simple but powerful vision: To extend small-molecule medicines into new realms of biology, unlocking that biology for medicine. We are pioneering new territory, with an expedition led by a team of skilled scientists and drug development leaders who are inventive yet pragmatic. We are on a bold and exciting mission, a mission not without peril, but we have an energized, collaborative, creative and fearless team ‚Äì a team that has consistently breached barriers and blazed new trails in search of solutions. We are now poised to realize the promise of bringing RNA into play for small-molecule drug discovery.  Pushing the frontier of this emerging field of science is gratifying, but our mission goes beyond the thrill of scientific discovery.  We believe that by targeting RNA biology in new ways, we have the potential to impact millions of patients.  Our platform will allow us to reach hundreds of biological targets not currently accessible to medicine, including known targets previously considered ‚Äúundruggable.‚Äù Our destination is powerful new therapies for patients everywhere, by opening up a new path for discovering RNA-targeted medicines.

Company Li Description: A stealth startup is a startup company that operates in stealth mode, i.e. that avoids public attention. This may be done to hide information from competitors, or ‚Äî as part of a marketing strategy ‚Äî to manage public image. The phenomenon is well known in the venture capital (VC) community. Normally a company would only operate in stealth mode for the first couple of years. As investors may have to disclose funding a stealth startup, their names are made public, but often only a general summary description is known about the company. "Most entrepreneurs say they are in stealth because they are worried about competitors stealing their ideas. This can be a risk if you have such a simple idea that just by hearing it, someone can replicate it."‚Äã

An innovative online platform that empowers mental health professionals to create their own Artificially Intelligent digital therapists and provide on demand online therapy to millions of users around the world.   What is Artificial Intelligence?  Artificial intelligence (AI) is the ability of a computer program or a machine to think and learn. It is also a field of study which tries to make computers "smart"‚Äã. In general use, the term "artificial intelligence"‚Äã means a machine which mimics human cognition. At least some of the things we associate with other minds, such as learning and problem solving can be done by computers, though not in the same way as we do. Andreas Kaplan and Michael Haenlein define AI as a system‚Äôs ability to correctly interpret external data, to learn from such data, and to use those learnings to achieve specific goals and tasks through flexible adaptation.  What can an AI digital therapist do?  An AI digital therapist can learn to mimic natural conversation patterns of the mental health professional that created it. This technique is referred to as scripting. Through scripting an AI can be trained to provide general counselling to individuals who suffer from mental health issues 24/7 anywhere around the world. The AI also has built in superpowers such as linguistic and sentiment analysis that allows the machine to automatically uncover important personality insights about the user. These insights can be used for providing more effective therapy. The AI can also be trained to talk through text or simulate voice conversations with the user.

As the founder of EVAAI, I also develop innovative solutions for mental health professionals and their clients. EVAAI is a platform for building automated support systems that provide basic counselling when the therapists are not available. We offer a no-code platform for creating AI-powered apps, such as AI assistants, facial and object recognition models, text analytic models, and generative music models. We also provide affordable hosting, training, and no-code API deployment to social media, web, native apps, and IoT devices.  My main fields of expertise include strategy, product management, cloud computing, managing teams, machine learning, and deep learning. I am passionate about applying AI technologies to solve real-world problems and improve people's lives.

Company Li Description: Cordance Medical is developing a focused ultrasound system that enables precision medicine to brain diseases.  We accomplish this by opening the blood-brain barrier (BBB), extending life by accelerating drug approvals, and enabling liquid biopsy (blood) tests to provide a real-time view of the tumor biology.  Our platform allows us to open the BBB precisely to physician-directed regions of the brain (e.g., tumor site, amyloid plaque) in a simple, non-invasive 30-minute clinic procedure.  Extensive pre-clinical and clinical investigations have demonstrated the safety and efficacy of the focused ultrasound technology at opening the BBB.  Cordance has developed a strong IP position enabling a painless, quick, and outpatient product deployment to meet the needs of the community.  The company seeks to raise a seed round to fund the company through all pre-clinical activities enabling pivotal human studies next year.  Our platform is applicable for glioblastoma (GBM), brain metastasis, Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, epilepsy and mental health.

Company Li Description: A stealth startup is a startup company that operates in stealth mode, i.e. that avoids public attention. Normally a company would only operate in stealth mode for the first couple of years. As investors may have to disclose funding a stealth startup, their names are made public, but often only a general summary description is known about the company. Someday we'll get lattes from robot baristas and therapy from AI chatbots, but despite technology's sprint toward the future, human brains remain the same. That's where I come in.   Hi! i'm Britt Frank, licensed neuropsychotherapist, personal leadership expert, and author of The Science of Stuck and The Getting Unstuck Workbook (Penguin Random House).  The Shiny Professional Info: I received my BA from Duke University and my MSW from The University of Kansas, where I later became an award-winning adjunct professor. My work has been featured in Forbes, Esquire, The New York Times,  NPR, New York Magazine, Fast Company, SHRM, and Psychology Today.   The Sordid Personal Info: Behind the curtain of my seemingly normal life, I struggled for more than two decades with addiction and anxiety, fully convinced that change was for other people, not for me. When I learned what I now teach, everything changed.  Why This Matters: Personal leadership and peak performance require more than mindset- I teach the simple science of big results.  You DON'T need motivation to overcome procrastination.  You DON'T need to know "why" you're stuck to get unstuck.  You DON‚ÄôT need to dive into feelings or empathy to be an effective and human-centered leader.  I deliver actionable, science-backed strategies so you can get yourself and your team back into the driver's seat of life.   What You Get During a Keynote: An entertaining and fast-paced ride filled with fluff-free, practical tools grounded in neuroscience. Everyone knows what it's like to get stuck. And the way forward is simpler than you'd think.  What does LSCSW, SEP mean? LSCSW means I am licensed to practice psychotherapy. SEP means I completed a 3 year post-graduate neuroscience-based training program. Shocking fact-- many psychotherapists are NOT required to learn anything about the brain in graduate school. Strange but true.   When our brains BRAIN better, life gets better. Learn more at www.scienceofstuck.com

EDUCATION DIFFERENTLY We are dedicated to transforming the education system by fostering a holistic approach to learning, driven by values, systems thinking, and real-world experiences that challenge and inspire. OTHER PROGRAMS * GAIA WEEKS bespoke beyond the classroom weeks for schools * SUSTAINABILITY MINDSET WITH DESIGN THINKING integrated into curriculums or an after-school/holiday program. * CLIMATE FRESK is a short workshop exploring causes and effects of climate change and reflecting on the role each of us plays in finding solutions. * IMPACT WORKSHOPS focussing on a specific skill from our other programs  COLLABORATION FOR IMPACT We cannot do it alone! I believe that in the future refurbished / second hand / lease will be mainstream. Buying new will be 'not done'. We have to make this shift in mindset to safe our planet - for us and our children! Company Specialities: CDR, Enhanced Weathering, Carbon drawdown
Company Li Description: Healthy rivers make a healthy planet. Our mission is to restore the health of rivers and their natural ability to draw carbon from land-to-ocean.
Lead Summary: I grew up playing on the banks of the Capilano River in BC and fell in love with rivers and the salmon who live in them.  I had the fortune to train under great scientists in hydrology and climate change in Canada, USA and France.  In 2010 I joined the faculty at Dalhousie University in Halifax Canada and founded the Hydrology and Climate Change Research Group. Since then, my team has been busy documenting the extent of chronic acidification in Nova Scotia's forests and rivers, and the urgent threats it poses to ecosystems and wildlife. We have developed novel approaches to monitoring, assessing and evaluating water quality and quantity. Most recently I have been developing economically viable technologies that can reduce the toxic legacy of terrestrial and freshwater acidification while increasing carbon drawdown. I founded CarbonRun to make this technology more accessible and widely available to combat climate change and protect threatened ecosystems and wildlife.

Pet Video Verify, headquartered in Raleigh, NC,  is a software company that is committed to making software that allows pet/animal owner to better manage their pets. A person will take a video of a found pet and our system will match the found video to the lost video of the pet, returning the owner information. The user who list a pet lost can select a reward amount, when a user finds the pet and returns it, they receive 85% of the reward amount. Another application is for the pet owner to store pet medical records online in which they will have 24x7 access to. Our long term vision is to create additional applications to solve pet owner needs.  Pet Video Verify is a two time semi-finalist in a MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) CHIEF business plan competition. Company Li Description: PAY YOUR TUITION is a financial services firm for students seeking lower the cost to fund their education. PYT Funds is a financial services firm seeking to provide economic and educational equality to students.  We are an online platform that connects the banks and families while using a shared economy method to reduce the burden of student loan debt.    We are creating  a new way to finance student loans. A stealth startup is a startup company that operates in stealth mode, i.e. that avoids public attention. This may be done to hide information from competitors, or ‚Äî as part of a marketing strategy ‚Äî to manage public image. The phenomenon is well known in the venture capital (VC) community. Normally a company would only operate in stealth mode for the first couple of years. As investors may have to disclose funding a stealth startup, their names are made public, but often only a general summary description is known about the company. "Most entrepreneurs say they are in stealth because they are worried about competitors stealing their ideas. This can be a risk if you have such a simple idea that just by hearing it, someone can replicate it."‚Äã

Lead Summary: Fr√©d√©ric has a passionate entrepreneurial mindset and problem-solving. This perfectly matches his ‚Äúthinking slow‚Äù (strategic, analytical ‚Ä¶) and ‚Äúacting fast‚Äù (decisive, hands-on) personality. This makes it possible to combine a long-term outlook and perseverance to achieve goals and outwork others (both people and companies).    As an "Architect" (INTJ) is one of the rarest and most strategically capable personality types (only 2% of the population). Although Fr√©d√©ric is a strong believer in working hard, doing what you love, high energy, high velocity is possible without having the feeling of a possible looming burnout if you believe in the value of your work, to you, the family and society.   As a founder of Aquila Ventures made me experience the value of helping out startups, and share their highs and lows. Company Name: Advanced Research Projects Agency For Health
Company Li Description: The Advanced Research Projects Agency for Health (ARPA-H) is committed to solving the most challenging problems in health by developing research programs dedicated to urgency, excellence and honesty. Part of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, ARPA-H aims to accelerate breakthroughs that empower every American to realize their full health potential ‚Äì turning the seemingly impossible to the possible to the actual.  The ARPA model is a continuous cycle of planning, implementing, and evaluating, and we‚Äôre looking for the best ideas and the brightest minds to carry out each process. We‚Äôre committed to diversity in all its forms.    Find more information about the agency and current job opportunities at https://arpa-h.gov
Lead Summary: I have over 15 years in translational oncology and lead a large national team across multiple sites responsible for developing and executing translational initiatives that span pre-clinical research to clinical trials. This collaborative interdisciplinary program integrates genomic, clinical, and experimental data with mathematical models and computational analyses to design effective treatment strategies for cancer patients.  Our research leverages large collections of patient tumor samples taken before, during and after therapy, as well as experimental and clinical data, to develop next-gen biomarkers predictive of how a tumor will respond to therapy and to identify drug targets in resistant tumors.  Our program also develops new technologies and methods to investigate the diversity of cancer, stromal, and immune cell biology in patient tumors, and to understand how these different cell populations communicate during treatment and contribute to therapy response and resistance. My research program has developed exploratory biomarkers for translational research, as well as integrated transcriptomic and genetic biomarkers into multiple early and late stage clinical trials for clinical decision making. In addition, I am leader of a translational oncology initiative nationwide with leading cancer centers and the National Cancer Institute (NCI) to expand systems biology based clinical trials. These studies are supported by seamless collaboration across biological, computational, mathematical, and clinical disciplines, as well as mentorship and support of team members.

A stealth startup is a startup company that operates in stealth mode, i.e. that avoids public attention. This may be done to hide information from competitors, or ‚Äî as part of a marketing strategy ‚Äî to manage public image. The phenomenon is well known in the venture capital (VC) community. Normally a company would only operate in stealth mode for the first couple of years. As investors may have to disclose funding a stealth startup, their names are made public, but often only a general summary description is known about the company. "Most entrepreneurs say they are in stealth because they are worried about competitors stealing their ideas. This can be a risk if you have such a simple idea that just by hearing it, someone can replicate it."‚Äã

Company Li Description: About Connect:  At Connect, we are on a mission to revolutionize the world of education and workforce development. Our company is dedicated to creating a dynamic ecosystem that prioritizes quality, accessibility, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness in the fields of entrepreneurship, leadership, and technology.   Our Vision: We envision a future where unemployment rates are significantly reduced, and the global workforce is filled with highly skilled and empowered individuals. Our vision extends beyond borders, with a particular focus on uplifting communities in Africa and across the globe.  Our Approach: Connect is committed to bridging the gap between education and employment. We believe that everyone deserves the opportunity to access world-class learning resources and gain the skills needed to thrive in the ever-evolving job market. To achieve this, we offer a wide range of courses, workshops, and mentorship programs that cater to individuals at all stages of their learning journey.  Key Pillars: 1. Quality: We are dedicated to delivering top-tier educational content curated by industry experts and thought leaders. Our commitment to quality ensures that learners receive the best education possible.  2. Accessibility: We break down barriers to education by providing online and offline learning options. Whether you're in a bustling city or a remote village, Connect is accessible to all.  3. Efficiency: Time is valuable, and we respect that. Our programs are designed to be efficient, allowing learners to acquire relevant skills in a timely manner.  4. Cost-effectiveness: We believe that education should not burden your finances. Connect offers affordable learning solutions without compromising on quality.  Impact: Our initiatives are driven by a desire to make a tangible impact on unemployment rates. By preparing individuals with the skills required in entrepreneurship, leadership, and technology, we are contributing to a brighter future for communities in Africa and around the world.  Join us at Connect and be part of a global movement that empowers individuals to shape their own destinies and build a brighter future for themselves and their communities. Together, we can unlock the potential of the next generation of leaders and innovators. Connect with us today and embark on your journey to success.

Company Specialities: admissions consulting, college applications, college admissions, college entrance prep, essay writing, personal statements, ivy league admissions, advising international students, edtech, big data, education
Company Li Description: Launched in 2014, AdmitSee helps students make better college application decisions with analytics and peer insights.  The online platform features the largest searchable database of college application files ‚Äì including essays, extracurriculars, test scores, and advice. The files are all uploaded by college students themselves and displayed in LinkedIn-style profiles. Prospective college students get to read real application examples and connect with the college students behind them.  The revenue-share model offers college students an easy way to make money by passing down their personal application journeys and insights to younger students ‚Äì for every view their profiles get, they earn a commission. Not only does it bring transparency to the black box of admissions, AdmitSee believes it pays to pay it forward.  AdmitSee's mission is to level the admissions playing field so college is accessible to any student who has the smarts and the ambition to attend. True to its mission, AdmitSee offers affordable access. Users may pay a monthly fee of $49.99/mo or an annual fee of $169.99/yr to view an unlimited number of profiles and gain access to exclusive data insights. But, cost should never be a factor when it comes to access. Students who qualify for aid under college readiness programs can upgrade to unlimited access at no cost.  AdmitSee's database boasts millions of data points that allow the team to apply data science to the admissions process. Now, both quantitative AND qualitative information can be analyzed to provide big picture admissions trends or personalized recommendations for individual users. The data is applicable not just for students but for institutional players as well to achieve better retention rates or improve recruitment methods.  By providing cost-effective, direct access to data-driven peer insights, AdmitSee empowers applicants to improve their application strategies, find trusted peer mentors, and plan for their futures.

If you believe climate change or global warming to be a myth, then BetterTomorrow is for you! We all see the repercussions of how the world suffers due to our actions, but very few care. We cover stories that truly matter - stories that have the power to change how corporate giants work around sustainability, stories that influence how governments come up with their "green policies", stories that will ensure our kids see a greener, cleaner and better future!   As we know, it's not all rainbows and colors - the plastic pollution chokes our blue oceans, the increasing CO2 in the atmosphere chokes us, and the rapid deforestation causes animals to go extinct. The Joint CMU-Pitt Ph.D. Program in Computational Biology (CPCB) provides interdisciplinary training in using quantitative and computational approaches to tackle scientific questions that lie at the interface of the life, physical, engineering, and computer sciences.  CPCB trainees are taught and mentored by leading experts at two of the foremost computer science and biomedical research institutions in the world.  The program provides students with interdisciplinary training in various fields of computational biology: Cellular and Systems Modeling, Computational Structural Biology, Bioimage Informatics, and Computational Genomics.  CPCB students also benefit from numerous professional development opportunities available at both host institutions.  Together, the CPCB program positions our students to be leaders in this exciting field of biology and has prepared our graduates to go on to successful careers in academia, industry, and beyond!

Company Specialities: Agritech, Cricket Farming, Sustainable Farming, Alternative Protein, Dried Crickets, Protein Powder, Pet Supplement, Cricket Powder, Whole Roasted Cricket, Farming IOT
Company Li Description: We are a cricket farm that produces alternative protein sources from cricket. Our mission is to deliver eco-friendly protein for a healthier life. As the population grows, an increasing demand for food and raw materials requires sustainable, scalable solutions that keep our world healthy.   In Indonesia, we are pioneering the insect agriculture industry by integrating a wide range of cutting-edge technologies to operate the smartest and most environmentally responsible protein production system on the planet. Our cricket farm is committed to environmental sustainability. We use a variety of practices to reduce our environmental impact, including: - Sustainable farming practices: We use organic feed and water, and provide our crickets with plenty of space to move around. - Water conservation: We use a closed-loop system to recycle water and only use the amount of water necessary for our crickets to thrive. - Energy efficiency: We use energy-efficient lighting and equipment, and optimize our production processes. - Waste management: We compost food scraps and recycle other waste materials. We believe that by taking these steps, we can help to reduce our environmental impact and create a more sustainable future for our planet.  Our products include cricket powder for humans, dried cricket for birds, reptiles, fish, and sugar glider food. And we also produce cricket powder for animal supplements. We're excited to introduce our new cricket products, a sustainable and eco-friendly source of protein. We're helping to reduce the environmental footprint while providing you with a nutritious and delicious alternative. We hope people enjoy it and join us on our journey towards a more sustainable future!

Lead Summary: Irena Chaushevska Danilovska, a trailblazing entrepreneur at the intersection of Space Innovations, NeuroEntrepreneurship, and FinTech, is at the vanguard of cultivating a unique innovation landscape at Silicon Coast Valley, Merritt Island, Florida. Her mission is to intertwine space technology with advanced human cognitive understanding and spearhead the development of a dynamic startup community in the space and life sciences industries.   With her rich background in business, law, and entrepreneurship, Irena excels as a serial entrepreneur, angel investor, and developer of startup ecosystems. A passionate advocate for brain circulation, Irena envisions transforming emerging economies into vibrant innovation hubs, promoting exponential development and job creation.  As the CEO and co-founder of NewMan's Business Accelerator, she has propelled the growth of startups across Europe and North America, connecting them with global mentors and investors. This led to her role as the first Macedonian lecturer at Stanford University, where she shared insights on European innovation and startup dynamics.  Supported by a Ph.D. scholarship from the University of York, her academic pursuit in Applied Neuroscience anchors her pioneering work in NeuroEntrepreneurship, analyzing the traits of 10,000 successful entrepreneurs worldwide. Irena is engaged in neuro-performance research and talent identification, particularly focusing on demanding environments.  Irena's journey in space innovation includes being an alumna of Singularity University's Global Solutions Program, where she explored exponential technologies and contributed to an innovative multilayer space suit project. She is also a fellow of the U.S. State Department's Young Transatlantic Innovative Leaders Initiative. Company Li Description: A stealth startup is a startup company that operates in stealth mode, i.e. that avoids public attention. Normally a company would only operate in stealth mode for the first couple of years. As investors may have to disclose funding a stealth startup, their names are made public, but often only a general summary description is known about the company. Company Li Description: Born out of a necessity during a surprisingly rainy New York City evening in May of 2017, The Jacket Club was founded by four best friends: Hale, Zach, Chandler, and Roberto. The four share not only their time by the Bay at the United States Naval Academy, but also a love of fine sports coats, skipping practice parades, and spending time with friends in Downtown Annapolis at Acme, McGarveys or Dillos.   After graduation, as is tradition, all four friends swore to never return to the Yard and PCS‚Äôd to distant parts of the world serving in various positions and posts in the Navy and the Marine Corps, but always keeping in touch and united by their original Jacket Club. After spending four years apart, the original Jacket Club members reunited in San Diego, California. While helping one of the Jacket Club members move houses, the four reminisced on their time at USNA when they found an old ‚ÄúBlue Magnet‚Äù. They realized that although they spent all four years at USNA trying to escape the absurdity of midshipmen life, one thing that they did enjoy at the Academy was catching a nice post noon-meal formation nap, either in or on, the beloved ‚ÄúBlue Magnet‚Äù.   Enter, The Jacket Club.  In order to commemorate the time shared by the Bay, these four friends thought what better way to combine their love of jackets and time shared in The Hall than have an actual piece of the Academy to wear. The Goat Jacket is hand crafted and designed to incorporate a piece of the Naval Academy that we hope present and past midshipmen like us can now wear anywhere around the world from downtown Annapolis to Yokosuka, Japan.  Whether it is on the field at the Navy and Marine Corps Stadium, on the Wesley Brown Track, in the Hall, in Nimitz trying to pass Calculus II, or your Firstie-year Dirt presentation on invading France, we encourage you to find your club that will last a lifetime. Until then, welcome in.

Lead Summary: It's important to me to become a chimera of highly technical, highly creative, and highly empathetic. I am excited by the idea of crossing unconventional borders and setting new precedents. I believe in the beauty of precision, the power of hard work, and the necessity of completion. I place a premium on excellent UX and spend my time thinking and creating at the intersection of AI and impactful problem areas.  My work currently revolves around Yuva AI, where I've developed a software platform that develops computer vision AI systems more efficiently and ethically with simulated images and videos. The tool can generate data for all industries and I‚Äôve created the world's first truly representative synthetic human generator for computer vision AI. The framework and tool I developed has been adopted by companies developing AI worth $1B+ annually. These include Fortune 500s and blue-chip venture-backed firms across Europe, North America and APAC.  I believe AI has the potential to help us realise our shared dream of a better future for all of humanity if developed with inclusivity and ethics at its core. As noted in Stanford‚Äôs 100AI report released in September ‚Äò21, AI has made a major leap from the lab to people‚Äôs lives in recent years, which increases the urgency to understand its potential negative effects - a few of which we have already seen materialise in deaths from self driving cars and wrongful incarcerations due to biased facial recognition. I believe that what we do now to understand, guide and develop human-centered AI is setting up the future of generations to come. That reality motivates me. Being privileged to have witnessed first-hand the failures of cutting-edge AI as a teenager, I believe it is more important than ever to build the table for conversations where they need to be happening. While I‚Äôve begun addressing this problem at a technical level with synthetic data, what I‚Äôve realised is that this problem is bigger than a simple software fix. AI will affect every aspect of our lives and our civilization, from social bonds and ethics to the economy and healthcare, education and government. My aim is to begin facilitating discussions and building coalitions with leaders across disciplines and continents to influence policy, regulations and public discourse at a global level.

Company Li Description: The Second Shift connects a network of thousands of highly-skilled, rigorously vetted female experts with forward-thinking businesses seeking outstanding talent for either hybrid, flexible, project-based, or full-time opportunities. Our partner companies include J.P. Morgan, Microsoft, Twitter, Etsy, Compass, JetBlue, One Medical, and many more.  At The Second Shift, we wholeheartedly believe in the sweeping opportunities the on-demand economy presents to encourage diversity in the workplace and strengthen success for businesses of all sizes and industries. Given that executive-level gender diverse companies are 21% more likely to experience above-average profitability, The Second Shift makes it easy for companies to solve for diversity, equity, and flexibility by connecting them to the best independent talent the workforce has to offer.  We are champions of flexible remote work as a solution for retaining female talent, and we firmly believe America will see more women in executive level positions if they are given opportunities to continue growing their careers even during transitional times like early motherhood. Time and time again, women are sidelined when they are faced with juggling work and family obligations, and we see this as a major loss of talent in the American workforce.   As one of Fast Company‚Äôs top ten most innovative workplace companies, we are here to bolster the talent economy, and support women in making work, work for them!  Find us in The New York Times, Forbes, Fortune, Entrepreneur, USA Today, GMA, and more.  Focus areas: #womeninbusiness, #flexibleworking, #wellness, #futureofwork, #workfromhome, gender equity in the workplace, family leave policy, talent economy, executive level female talent
Lead Summary: Jenny Galluzzo is the co-founder of The Second Shift, an innovative professional network connecting thousands of highly-skilled vetted women to flexible work opportunities with partner companies including J.P. Morgan, Twitter, Etsy, and more.   Jenny created The Second Shift alongside her business partner Gina Hadley after experiencing firsthand how hard it was to shift careers, especially after having children. Jenny understood that too many women are sidelined when family and work become overwhelming, and this has been especially true throughout the pandemic. A fierce advocate for flexible remote work as a means for retaining female talent, Jenny is committed to placing women in the driver seats of their careers so they can build lives rooted in confidence, intention, and optimism. In addition, Jenny is keenly aware that women make up just 6% of CEOs, and believes gender equity at the very top of corporate America is not only necessary but also possible if women are given opportunities to remain engaged in their careers while also taking time for their families. Her thought leadership on women and work has been featured in The New York Times, Forbes, Fortune, Entrepreneur, USA Today, GMA, and more.   At The Second Shift, Jenny spearheads community growth, cultivating a network of thousands of expert women and curating events across the country to bring members and business partners together to discuss how to optimize the personal and professional success of working women with a focus on their mental, emotional and spiritual wellness. Jenny also orchestrates all things branding, including overseeing messaging, communications, and content channels. Needless to say, the journey to grow a startup from the ground-up has been incredibly stimulating and fulfilling.  On top of that, my experience as a software engineer on the Azure Kubernetes Service team (AKS) and on the Azure Blockchain team building enterprise-grade blockchain services has given me the skills and tools I need to build scalable and extensible software.  ---- It's hard to define where I'm from, but growing up in the US, Singapore, Japan, and the UK has shaped me into a multicultural individual, passionate to bridge different cultures together.  I find learning about other people's cultures truly fascinating. I love traveling and learning the local language and the way of life. However in our hectic lives, it's often difficult to drop what we're doing and live in another country; we don't even leave time to go out of our way to meet different people living in the same community.  From personal experience, I believe working together on the same team with someone from a different culture can accelerate this learning process. While peoples' beliefs and cultures may be different, I find that many times we share common values and aspirations. My vision is to use technology to allow people from different backgrounds to find and work with each other towards a common goal, which I believe will eliminate cultural barriers and facilitate our understanding of other cultures.  Interesting (and random) idea - wouldn't it be cool if you can see pictures/videos about some topic when someone is talking? A lot of times people can't relate to each other because they just don't share the same background or are imagining different things as they listen. If you can share that emotional factor somehow, both parties could come to a mutual understanding faster. Many ways to share "emotions" via technology but photos/videos might be an interesting start!  Shoot me a message if you want to talk! I'd love to get in touch.

The Cash Out Plan is based on the strategies that Greg Porto used to close 125 transactions worth $4 billion over 30 years. Lead Summary: My experience motivated me to solve a big, recurring problem:    A large number of business owners try, and fail, to sell their business. It could be that their exit price is way less than expected or the sale doesn‚Äôt even happen.   After decades of deals, I saw that failed exits mostly occur for one or more of these 5 reasons:  1. Little advanced planning 2. Unrealistic goals 3. Theoretical valuations 4. No focus on salability 5. Winging the process   I knew if these 5 problems could be addressed head on it would guarantee a successful exit for the greatest value.   When I tell owners about the 5 problems, they understand. They also realize that the sale of their business is the most important deal they‚Äôll ever do.   But, they tell me there are two more immediate issues: They don‚Äôt know how to get started with exit planning and they have no time to spare.   So I created The Cash Out Plan, a sale planning and advisory service.   It addresses both: a) the 5 reasons exits fail and b) the need for a practical process that time constrained owners can use for a successful exit.   The Cash Out Plan helps business owners:   üëâ Create an exit plan using a practical, time efficient system  üëâ Understand the key steps to reach aggressive value and timing goals  üëâ Determine valuation based on real buyer feedback, not theory  üëâ Fix business issues that could blow up their deal  üëâ Use a tight process to position and market their business, closing with the buyer that pays the most    The Cash Out Plan is based on my 30 years of experience helping business owners realize their financial dreams. Company Specialities: Reduction in Plastic Consumables in the Laboratory, Reduction of Biohazard Waste in the lab, High Throughput Tip Washer, TipNovus, Laboratory Automation Devices & Integration
Company Li Description: Grenova‚Ñ¢ is an innovative company that is revolutionizing lab consumables through high-quality waste reduction solutions. Our mission is to lower costs in the laboratory industry and reduce biohazard waste in the environment by delivering groundbreaking approaches in dealing with plastic consumables.   Every year, over 5 million pounds of plastic pipette tips are disposed of in landfills globally after a single use. This drives significant environmental pollution and unnecessary costs. The typical laboratory consumes several thousand pipette tips every day for samples and assay procedures, due to the lack of options for safely cleaning plastic consumables. Such high consumption of plastic tips adds $25,000 to $1.5 million in annual operational costs for laboratories worldwide.  At Grenova‚Ñ¢, we know that high consumption of plastic tips is an excessive, avoidable operational cost for companies and a significant contributor to environmental pollution. This is why we decided to create devices that enable labs to wash and recycle pipette tips in large quantities. Grenova devices offer labs the option to reuse plastic tips several times, cutting associated costs by up to 90%. Grenova devices are safe for both the user and the environment, without producing hazardous waste or gases.  visit us at: www.grenovasolutions.com
Lead Summary: Ali Safavi, founder, President, and CEO of Grenova, is on a mission to enable laboratories around the world to become sustainable and waste-free. Ali founded Grenova, which is short for Green Innovation, after 8 years of working in the life sciences industry and discovering an unsustainable practice within the laboratories. Grenova was founded based on innovating green technologies and manufacturing automated devices to wash and reuse plastic consumables for laboratories. Today, Ali‚Äôs award-winning company has created the only technology solution in the industry that enables life sciences and healthcare laboratories to reduce their plastic consumables biohazard waste and cost by over 90%.  As a result of his work, Grenova has eliminated over 1.2 billion pipette tips ‚Äì equivalent to over 2.6M lbs. of plastic that would have otherwise ended up in landfills as biohazard waste. In addition, Grenova has helped the industry save over $80M by washing and sanitizing pipette tips. Grenova's headquarters is currently located in the Greater Scott‚Äôs Edition in Richmond VA ‚Äì 32,000 sf. With over 50 employees. Ali‚Äôs ultimate vision is to implement an automated cleaning technology device in every lab across the globe to safely clean and sterilize all of the used plastic consumables from each lab‚Äôs daily operation and return them back to the lab for reuse over and over again without any compromise on quality and performance.   For these efforts, Ali was named one of the Top Healthcare Innovators of 2019 in Healthcare Technology magazine, Top Innovator by Silicon Valley Magazine, and Top 10 Best Successful CEOs of 2020 by the Industry Era publication. Grenova was recognized in 2019 as an ‚ÄúInno On Fire‚Äù company by American Inno, rvAwesome Awards finalist by Venture Forum, and the Technology Project of the Year award winner by Richmond Technology Council. Ali has also been a speaker at the TED Talk.

A stealth startup is a startup company that operates in stealth mode, i.e. that avoids public attention. This may be done to hide information from competitors, or ‚Äî as part of a marketing strategy ‚Äî to manage public image. The phenomenon is well known in the venture capital (VC) community. Normally a company would only operate in stealth mode for the first couple of years. As investors may have to disclose funding a stealth startup, their names are made public, but often only a general summary description is known about the company. "Most entrepreneurs say they are in stealth because they are worried about competitors stealing their ideas. This can be a risk if you have such a simple idea that just by hearing it, someone can replicate it."‚Äã

The entire OSW industry wants to buy locally--and their ability to take advantage of steep tax credits and incentives depends on doing so. But when leading research organizations like NREL say there is simply not a domestic supply chain, how will OSW get built?  We are a unified information management platform that sits between buyers and suppliers. On Cut-In, suppliers provide detailed information about their business (e.g., financial, operational, demographic) that match buyers' actual concerns. Suppliers get detailed gap assessments to improve their competitiveness in OSW, while buyers get richer detail about suppliers' actual ability to wok in OSW delivery environments.   Suppliers and buyers track contract outcomes and local content, spend, and hiring in real-time using data provided back to Cut-In by suppliers.  Learn more at www.CutIn.app

Company Li Description: Welcome to Bijliride! We provide sustainable, eco-friendly and affordable rental solutions for urban mobility. With the rise of urbanization, traffic congestion, and air pollution, we saw a need for a greener alternative to traditional gas-powered vehicles. Whether you're running errands, commuting to work, or just exploring the city, our electric scooters are a fun and efficient way to get around. We understand that the convenience of personal transportation is important, which is why we've made it easy to rent our electric scooters through a user-friendly app. Our app-based booking system and flexible rental options make it simple for customers to enjoy the benefits of electric transportation without the hassle of ownership. We believe that sustainability should be a core value for any modern business, and we're committed to leading by example. At our electric 2-wheeler rental startup, we're proud to be part of the solution to a major environmental problem. By providing a clean and green transportation option and promoting the use of electric scooters, we're helping to reduce the carbon emissions in our cities and improve the quality of life for everyone. We're passionate about making a positive impact on the environment while providing a high-quality service to our customers. That's why we're continually exploring new ways to improve our operations and reduce our environmental impact. But our mission goes beyond. We also believe in fostering a sense of community and collaboration among our customers and partners. We are always looking for ways to support local businesses, promote environmental awareness, and give back to the communities we serve. Join us on the road to a cleaner, greener future. Let's make electric urban mobility the norm, not the exception.

Company Specialities: Minimally Invasive Procedures, Bedside Procedures, Ultrasound, Intensive Care, Gastrostomy, Enteral Nutrition
Company Li Description: CoapTech is bringing a series of breakthrough medical devices to worldwide markets, leveraging a patented, disruptive platform technology called the Point-of-care Ultrasound Magnet Aligned (PUMA) System. The PUMA Platform will disrupt multiple medical procedures, reducing health care costs, and improving efficiency, safety, quality, patient experience, and access to services around the globe.   Invented by Dr. Steven Tropello, a Johns Hopkins-trained critical care physician, the PUMA System enables diagnostic, interventional and therapeutic procedures in hollow organs. The system combines magnetic attraction for device placement guidance, and ubiquitous, low-cost, point-of-care ultrasound for visualization in hollow cavities. Our lead device, the PUMA-G, selected because of its low risk, clear FDA pathway, and strong commercial viability, is for the insertion of Gastrostomy (feeding) tubes.   PUMA-G enables a point-of-care (i.e. bedside, as opposed to operating room) procedure for inserting gastrostomy tubes which can be quickly and easily performed by non-surgical providers. By eliminating specialty suites and specialist consultants, PUMA-G will save hospitals money and improve efficiency and safety for this common procedure. PUMA-G has been validated in human anatomy, and has a streamlined regulatory pathway based on FDA presubmission feedback.

Over the past four years, my administration delivered for Americans of all backgrounds like never before.  Save America is about building on those accomplishments, supporting the brave conservatives who will define the future of the America First Movement, the future of our party, and the future of our beloved country.  Save America is also about ensuring that we always keep America First, in our foreign and domestic policy.  We take pride in our country, we teach the truth about our history, we celebrate our rich heritage and national traditions, and of course, we respect our great American flag.  * We are committed to defending innocent life and to upholding the Judeo-Christian values of our founding fathers.  * We believe in the promise of the Declaration of Independence, that we are all made EQUAL by our Creator, and that we must all be TREATED equal under the law.    *. We know that our rights do not come from government, they come from God, and no earthly force can ever take those rights away.  That includes the right to KEEP AND BEAR ARMS.  * We believe in rebuilding our previously depleted military and ending endless wars our failed politicians of the past got us into for decades.  * We embrace free thought, we welcome robust debate, and we are not afraid to stand up to the oppressive dictates of political correctness.  * We know that the rule of law is the ultimate safeguard of our freedoms, and we affirm that the Constitution means exactly what it says AS WRITTEN.  * We support fair trade, low taxes, and fewer job-killing regulations, and we know that America must always have the most powerful military on the face of the Earth.  * We believe in Law and Order, and we believe that the men and women of law enforcement are HEROES who deserve our absolute support.    * We believe in FREE SPEECH and Fair Elections.  We must ensure fair, honest, transparent and secure elections going forward ‚Äî where every LEGAL VOTE counts.

She works to solve complex problems and drive results by unleashing the potential of each contributor for the benefit of all.¬† A champion of diversity she pays it forward with kindness, making a positive difference to all that she touches, connecting people and dots along the way.  Louise began her career in 2001 in Dublin at a production office of an Ad Agency designing offline ads for magazines and newspapers. In 2003 she went back into education, achieving a 1:1 hons Master of Science (MSc) in Marketing Practice by joining the ranks of the apprentice like - "Marketing Development Program" - in UCD Smurfit.     She then followed her dream of working in the heart of tech, moving to San Francisco for over 3 years where she worked for the Irish Government as a Business Development Executive at Enterprise Ireland. There, she immersed herself into the West Coast lifestyle, setting up Venture Capitalist meetings for Irish Tech/Wireless companies. She organized Presidential, Trade and Ministerial mission, traveled extensively and made wonderful connections in the "Valley".    In the meantime, Google had established its EMEA Headquarters and she didn't hesitate in accepting a job offer moving back to Ireland in 2007. Since then she has managed many sales teams at Google and built her expansive multi-market experience (Ireland, UK, Tax Havens, SEEMEA, Region 4, Emerging Markets, Sub Saharan Africa, Israel and more recently Northern Europe). This led her to a role with EMEA wide scope, she created the first "flex" team of senior consultants while wearing a second hat as the Chief of Staff for Northern Europe. She recently founded "ESAP"- a leadership sales development program for the EMEA Large Customer Sales organisation which aims to build the workforce of the future.    Louise is a strong proponent of DEI and established the Dublin Chapter of Women@Google, leading it's steering group for over five years and going on to set up Chapters in London, Paris, Wroclaw and Johannesburg. She became the EMEA Women@Google Chair in 2014 and held that position for several years. She is an active member of the Connecting Women in Technology steering committee. She helps educate young girls on CS and Tech as part of CWiT's  "I.T is not just for Geeks" program.  She volunteers for the homeless charity - Dublin Simon Community - on their Soup Run program for the past 12 years.  Louise is currently undertaking the IOD's Chartered Director Program.

Company Li Description: Character Biosciences (formerly Clover Therapeutics) is a precision medicine platform that is unlocking the patterns of age-related diseases in people of diverse backgrounds. Lead Summary: Growing up in Louisiana, I was no stranger to hurricanes and their powerful winds. From inches of rain to miles of flooding, I noticed at a young age, how the weather and our environments could be our worst enemies. Hurricanes destroy homes, wreck communities, and have the potential to harm and displace thousands of families. It wasn‚Äôt until my time at Duke University, that I could research, study, and conceptualize the impacts of hurricanes on communities ‚Äî the people and the built environment.    Starting my technical studies at Duke University, I recognized how structural integrity, civil planning, and decision-making influence the resiliency of a community. But, it‚Äôs the preparedness and awareness of the people in those communities that help to mitigate fatality. Hurricanes and other natural disasters cannot be prevented. Nature is inevitable. But as Civil Engineers and community leaders, we can develop a way to safely live in high-risk areas, and prepare our communities to respond when disaster is approaching.   With my passion for helping others through education and my passion for structural innovation in Civil Engineering, I plan to pursue a career in disaster management and structural engineering that allows me to assist at-risk communities through urban planning and resiliency structural design.

Company Li Description: A stealth startup is a startup company that operates in stealth mode, i.e. that avoids public attention. This may be done to hide information from competitors, or ‚Äî as part of a marketing strategy ‚Äî to manage public image. The phenomenon is well known in the venture capital (VC) community. Normally a company would only operate in stealth mode for the first couple of years. As investors may have to disclose funding a stealth startup, their names are made public, but often only a general summary description is known about the company. "Most entrepreneurs say they are in stealth because they are worried about competitors stealing their ideas. This can be a risk if you have such a simple idea that just by hearing it, someone can replicate it."‚Äã

Lead Summary: Germinal G. Van is an award-winning author, economist, political scientist, and scholar. He is a member of the National Association of Business Economics and the Economic History Association. He was born in Abidjan, Cote d‚ÄôIvoire. He immigrated to the United States in 2010. He obtained a bachelor‚Äôs degree in political science from the Catholic University of America in 2014, earned a master‚Äôs degree in political management from George Washington University in 2017, and acquired a non-degree certificate in Mathematical Statistics from Duke University. His works mainly focus on Public Choice Theory, Economic History, Econometrics, Statistics, and Mathematical Economics.   He is a proponent of neoclassical economics and classical liberalism. Mr. Van has written more than a dozen books in Economic History, Political Economy, Development Economics, Business Economics, and Macroeconomics. He has also written several columns for the Foundation for Economic Education (FEE) and the Mises Institute. Moreover, Mr. Van published several scientific papers, notably in professional academic journals such as the Journal of Economics and Econometrics, and in research platforms such as Research Papers in Economics, and ResearchGate. He is the winner of the 2021 Best Indie Book Award for Socioeconomic History and the 2022 Finalist of the National Indie Excellence Awards for U.S History.  He is the founder and CEO of the Lake Street Review, Inc., which is a newspaper publishing company focuses on reporting on financial markets, business, economics, and politics in the United States and Africa. The goal of creating this newspaper is to provide information that will create investment opportunities for our readers in both markets, the American and African markets.  He is also the founder and owner of GGV Publishing Company, an online-based publishing company designed to publish non-fiction and academic books in History, Politics, and Economics. The purpose of GGV Publishing Company is to enhance scholarship and to help authors leave their indelible marks on the world.
